Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory514.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "Get out! I said I don't want to take the pills!"}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maid', 3: 'Master Oakes, Dr. Richard has said that if you refuse to take your medications, your condition will...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Lies! He said that I would be back to school if I took the pills, but I'm still stuck at home... I won't take them anymore... Cough...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Master Oakes has always been a sickly child. He does not have a lot of friends, given how proud and reclusive he is.'}
{3: 'His father, the CEO of Universal Toys, almost never comes back to the manor and certainly never pays his son much attention.'}
{3: 'However, Master Oakes has been getting more interested in school lately, and he was returning home with a smile more often...'}
{3: 'Unfortunately, that was when his health took a turn for the worse... so much so that he could no longer go to school.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Enough. Just leave if there's nothing else.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As his maid is about to curtsy and leave, she remembers that something happened earlier today that might cheer up Master Oakes.'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: 'Master, your friends were here for you while you were doing your checkup...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "They were here?! Why didn't you tell me?!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'For once, the maid finally sees an expression of excitement one would expect from a child this young. She cannot help but feel heartened.'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: 'They were all worried about you, and they told you to get better soon so you can play that... that game together...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Norman Heroes! I told you many times before.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: "Right, right! That's the one. They even prepared a gift for you to cheer you on.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "A gift?! It can't be...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: "I'll give it to you if you take your pills, Master.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Hey! Are you blackmailing me...?!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: "You can't be scared of the medicines just because it's bitter, right, Master?", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Oakes turns away, tutting, but his hand reaches out.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Give it to me... I'm not afraid of pills.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Smiling, the maid hands over the medicines and the gift to Oakes.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "It is Norman Heroes 11! I didn't know it was on sale already... but...", 4: '1'}
{3: "The spark in his eyes dies as quickly as it lit up—Dr. Richard ordered Oakes' gaming console to be taken away so as not to affect his recovery. He will not be able to play his new game."}

{2: 'Maid', 3: 'I know the doctor requested it to be taken away... but who can blame an old maid for being forgetful and leaving something her master wanted under the bed when she was sweeping, right?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: 'Remember, you can only play a little every day... and...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maid and Oakes', 3: '"...Don\'t let the doctor know!"', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{3: 'Winter arrives in the blink of an eye. Cold as the weather may be, the snow poses no threat to the warm, luxurious Golden Age mansion.'}
{3: 'But the temperature is not the only thing that has plummeted. Hope has also dwindled in the house.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maid', 3: 'Master... Your medicines for today...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Oakes swallows the pills without looking—he has long gotten used to the bitter taste of them.'}
{3: 'Despite his daily medications, his condition has worsened to the point where he cannot leave his bed and walk.'}
{3: 'Trapped in this small room, Oakes can only escape into his game. Inside is a world where he can go on adventures and friends he can talk to about everything.'}
{3: 'Feeling lightheaded, he drops the controller he was trying to grab. He tries to reach for it, but he barely has the strength to shift his body.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "What use is this pointless body... Why don't you ask that garbage doctor to turn me into a bionic mechanoid instead?!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Oakes thrashes his legs furiously, but he feels nothing but numbness.'}
{3: "Despite how advanced prosthetic treatments are, Oakes' illness is not something that can be fixed by replacing a few body parts."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Maid', 3: "How can you say that?! You... won't even be human anymore if you do!", 4: '2'}
{3: "Universal Toys' bionic mechanoid technology during the Golden Age is the predecessor of Construct Tech, unknown to the public then and posing serious ethical issues."}

{3: 'The kind, elderly maid has not told Oakes the whole truth—she accidentally overheard his father asking Dr. Richard to investigate the possibility of turning him into a bionic mechanoid while performing checkups on him.'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: '(How could they do that... Master Oakes is a human!)', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Hmph... I'm kidding. Mechanoids... are just toys that pretend to be humans.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Oakes shakes his head as if trying to forget this ridiculous thought.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Recently... the people from school invited me to gun for the first place on the leaderboard together.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Maid', 3: "Isn't that nice? Playing with your friends is surely going to cheer you up. Didn't the doctor say it helps to do something that makes you happy?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "I said no... Look at the state I'm in. I can't even play well at home on my console... how do you expect me to get first place?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Right... I\'m not going to turn myself into one of those mechanoids, but if I only use them as a "tool" to improve my score...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Hey, you! Tell my father to bring me the newest mechanoid from his company... I might be a disappointment, but I'm sure he'll let me have this at the very least.", 4: '1'}

{3: 'Soon, a smart mechanoid from Universal Toys arrives at the estate. As mechanoids are popularly employed in all industries during the Golden Age, many mechanoids that specialize in different professions are produced.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Greetings. The initial setup has been completed. Are you Oakes, my master?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "I am. I wasn't expecting a piece of metal like you to be this articulate... No wonder you're the newest product from our company.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Is "a piece of metal" how I will be referred from now on?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "No... You don't need a name. You're just my tool, understood?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The mechanoid nods, imitating a human. This is the one thing Oakes cannot understand... He has no idea what the point of imitating humans is.'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Understood. Skipping the naming process... In what situation should I respond to you?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Come on... Can\'t you determine it yourself? I thought you were one of the "smart mechanoids"...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Determine it myself...?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Seemingly trapped in a prolonged, complicated computation, the mechanoid does not respond for a while.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "You're not broken, are you? Forget about that for now. I have another mission for you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Of course. What do you require?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Hearing a command it understands, the mechanoid can finally stop pondering the previous question for now.'}
{3: 'Oakes excitedly takes out the box for Norman Heroes 11 and shows the mechanoid.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Hey! Do you know what this is?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'This is Norman Heroes 11, the latest entry from the Norman Heroes series released on the TR-1200 platform this year. It...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Alright, alright. I don't need you to recite information from a database... I want you to play this game.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Please confirm... My mission... is to play a video game?', 4: '2'}

{3: 'Smart mechanoids have been integrated into all facets of human lives over time. Sharing workloads and offering support, they provide help to humans in many ways... but never has one been asked to "play a video game."'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Confirm, confirm! Now... follow my order and start playing this game until you gain first place on the leaderboard!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Confirmation required: the server I need to hack to complete this mission has an anti-cheat system. Doing so is illegal...', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The mechanoid gets smacked in the head by Oakes before it can finish speaking.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'You idiot! Who asked you to hack into their game server? Here... hold this!', 4: '1'}
{3: "Oakes shoves his controller into the mechanoid's hands before showing his open palms."}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'What are these?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'These are your hands, Master.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Oakes points at the mechanoid's hands afterward."}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'What are those?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'These are my mechanical hands.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'Nope. Starting today, your hands are my hands, understood?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "You'll use these hands to help me prove my ideas and maneuvers the human way...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'I recommend connecting my smart simulation program to your device to minimize the time required to calculate the best solution for your problem.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "What's the point of that...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'What do you mean?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Irritated, Oakes thwacks the mechanoid on its head, interrupting it.'}

{2: 'Oakes', 3: "Listen—I've asked them to plant a prioritized command in you. After you gain first place on the leaderboard offline, your input record will be logged before your personality data is deleted.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: 'I want to achieve first place with my own "strength," so you\'re nothing but my tool, understood?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Oakes scolds the mechanoid loudly as he defends the last hint of his dignity—this is all the "cheating" he will allow himself.'}
{3: 'The mechanoid does not understand why Oakes would intentionally opt for such an ineffective and restrictive approach.'}
{3: 'But it is just a mechanoid. It does not need to know the meaning behind its actions when its program is more than sufficient for it to start working.'}
{3: "So it carefully picks up its master's controller and puppets the character on the screen as Oakes instructed."}

{3: 'Only then does it realize that its assignment is not as simple as it appears—its mechanical palms interact with the game controller imperfectly, and there is a delay between its computation and movement.'}

{3: 'Moreover, it cannot pull the cable too hard and unplug the console or miss a game prompt due to the chirpings from the birds outside... Even with its superior computing power, it needs time to overcome these challenges.'}
{3: 'It finishes the game uncharacteristically incompetently. Watching from the side, Oakes chuckles at its results, but he does not look angry or dismissive.'}
{2: 'Oakes', 3: "You idiot... But that's okay. Let's try again.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Pressing restart, the mechanoid begins playing the game again, utilizing all its computing power to concentrate on the screen before it and the controller in its hands.'}
{3: "Oakes will come up with ways to further increase its score every time. With each game played, the mechanoid's ranking rises."}
{3: "Until one day, the mechanoid no longer hears the chirping outside or its master's command. The screen before it is black and unlit."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Diagnosis: power has been cut for unknown reasons... Mission interrupted.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The mechanoid tries to request Oakes to change his commands, but it receives no replies. It waits and waits for countless days.'}
{3: 'For some reason, the idea to leave and search for Oakes sprouts in its mind.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory361.png'}
{3: 'But it is attacked and damaged by scared humans not long after it leaves the estate, and that is when it first hears the phrase "Punishing Virus".'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory10.jpg'}
{3: 'The battered mechanoid is abandoned in a junkyard, fortunately with its memory shell intact. It spends years in sleep mode, unaware of its surroundings.'}
{3: 'One day, it suddenly detects a connection with an external power source, and it awakes from deep sleep.'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: "A fellow... who's not completely gone...", 4: '1'}

{3: "Regaining its vision, the mechanoid stares at the strange being before it and finds another mechanoid. It recalls from its database that this is the Nozzle model, which serves as a painter's assistant."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mechanoid', 3: 'Greetings. Am I the "fellow" you mentioned?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Nozzle', 3: "We've fixed... your body...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Nozzle pulls the mechanoid up, allowing it to see the other side of the junkyard—revealing a colorful graffiti on a wall.'}
{2: 'Nozzle', 3: "Our fellow... fellow... Witness our new work... Remember... Sagemachina's will...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "As the mechanoid's visual sensor sends the image to its analytical core, a tsunami of new data floods its memory shell."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory67.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgUi/BgFightLoading8.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgUi/BgFightLoading18.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgUi/BgFightLoading19.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgUi/BgFightLoading21.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgUi/BgActive01.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory31.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory43.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory291.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory10.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Nozzle sways before walking ahead, followed by many different kinds of mechanoids.'}
{2: 'Nozzle', 3: 'Fellows... fellows... We need to find... the Sagemachina...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The mechanoid hesitates. Standing among the flock of advancing mechanoids, it does not follow their footsteps and move.'}
{3: 'Staying where it is, it begins to ponder a question that it originally deprioritized, the question its master once posed.'}
{2: 'Mechanoid', 3: "Master Oakes... The thing that I want to do... I have to determine it myself, don't I?", 4: '3'}
{3: 'It realizes that it is still holding the controller that it tore away. Pressing the buttons, it feels familiar and strange at the same time.'}

{3: 'The mechanoid... wants to understand why Master Oakes taught him to play that game. He wants to understand why Master Oakes was so obsessed with getting first place in the Norman Heroes 11 leaderboard.'}
{3: 'Perhaps he will once he completes his objective... even if his personality data will be deleted afterward.'}
{3: 'He starts walking the opposite way from the group of mechanoids. For the first time in his existence, he walks toward the wild field of the future without an answer.'}
